subject: Leadership
title: Giving and Receiving Feedback
description: One-minute skill: Giving and Receiving Feedback.

hook.text: A manager avoids giving honest feedback for months. Then fires the employee. Who actually failed here?

buildup.text: Feedback is a giftâ€”but only if it's timely, specific, and delivered with care. Vague praise helps no one.

discovery.text: Kim Scott's 'Radical Candor' framework: care personally and challenge directly. Skip either, and feedback fails.

twist.text: Receiving feedback well is just as hard. Leaders who can't hear criticism create echo chambers around themselves.

climax.text: The best feedback cultures are bidirectional. Leaders ask for feedback as often as they give it.

punchline.text: Honest feedback is uncomfortable. Silence is worse.

quiz.question: What two elements does Radical Candor combine?
